title: ACCC sues Google over the use of location data
text:
The consumer watchdog has launched a court case against internet giant Google, alleging it misled Android users over how it collects, stores and users their personal location data.

Android mobile phone and tablet users received misleading information about how their location data would be collected and used when certain account settings were enabled or disabled from at least January 2017, the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission claims.

“Our case is that consumers would have understood as a result of this conduct that by switching off their ‘Location History’ setting, Google would stop collecting their location data, plain and simple,” ACCC chairman Rod Sims said.

The ACCC is suing both Google LLC and Google Australia in the Federal Court of Australia.

Google is yet to file a defence but plans to fight the allegations.

“We are currently reviewing the details of these allegations. We continue to engage with the ACCC and intend to defend this matter,” a Google spokeswoman said.

More to come.
